header_summary: Summary:Tom Briar suggests a new approach to handling lock time in transactions by grinding the block height instead of the lock time, potentially saving bytes. ZmnSCPxj expresses interest in Lightning as a non-blockchain mechanism for scaling blockchains and proposes integrating useful features from sidechains into Bitcoin. Nick Farrow discusses a draft scheme involving blinding and FROST compatibility for Bitcoin transactions. Bastien TEINTURIER submits a pull request to securely send administrative commands to a lightning node using a hardware security module. David Stainton discusses a modification to Sphinx and recommends keeping up with Kyber's standardization. Atomic Mr Nuclear highlights the permissioned nature of the Lightning channel for protection against Sybil attacks.

recent_posts.title: Compressed Bitcoin Transactions
recent_posts.summary:
- Tom discusses the current approach of handling lock time in transactions.
- He suggests dropping the grinding of lock time in favor of grinding block height.
- Tom raises concerns about efficiency and proposes an alternative solution to save space.

recent_posts.title: Sentinel Chains: A Novel Two-Way Peg
recent_posts.summary:
- The sender expresses initial interest in sidechains as a scaling solution for blockchains.
- Sidechains are seen as creating more blockchains that cannot scale, so attention turns to Lightning.
- Mainstake is suggested as an alternative for developing and prototyping features in sidechains.

recent_posts.title: Private Collaborative Custody with FROST
recent_posts.summary:
- The email discusses a draft scheme that explains blinding and FROST compatibility.
- The scheme involves obtaining a public nonce, constructing an aggregate FROST nonce, and calculating a challenge.
- The email emphasizes security assessment and suggests sequential signing sessions to mitigate risks.

recent_posts.title: Remotely control your lightning node from your favorite HSM
recent_posts.summary:
- Bastien has submitted a pull request to document a secure architecture for lightning nodes.
- The architecture minimizes changes to the lightning node and utilizes a hardware security module.
- He suggests implementing this idea and offers to provide specifications and review the implementation.

recent_posts.title: faster NIKE Sphinx or more secure KEM Sphinx
recent_posts.summary:
- David agrees with Laolu's understanding of a Sphinx modification, suggesting names like "PQ Sphinx" or "KEM Sphinx" when combined with ECDH and PQ KEM.
- David mentions PQ Noise utilizing KEMs, Cloudflare using Kyber, and provides relevant links.
- David recommends following Peter Schwabe for updates on Kyber standardization and discusses the benefits of upgrading protocols to use PQ cryptography.

recent_posts.title: Nucleus: Capital-efficient multipeer Lightning payment channels
recent_posts.summary:
- The Bitcoin blockchain is permissionless, but the Lightning channel is permissioned.
- Lightning channel requires authorization from all participants, providing protection against Sybil attacks.
- Reputation mechanisms can be used to ensure trustworthy participants in the Lightning channel.

active_posts.title: Blinded 2-party Musig2
active_posts.summary:
- We are implementing 2-of-2 Schnorr Musig2 for statechains without revealing sensitive information.
- The musig2 protocol involves generating private and public keys for both parties.
- Blinding is performed by party 1, while key and nonce aggregation is handled by party 2.

active_posts.title: Concern about "Inscriptions"
active_posts.summary:
- Storage for blockchain is limited but manageable with affordable hardware and ongoing optimization efforts.
- With a worst-case scenario, the growth of blockchain storage is approximately 210.24GB per year.
- A 5TB hard drive costing less than $150 would provide storage for 21 years.

active_posts.title: Concrete MATT opcodes
active_posts.summary:
- Salvatore Ingala has presented a complete proposal for the core opcodes of MATT.
- The new opcode, OP_CHECKCONTRACTVERIFY (CCV), replaces OP_CHECK{IN, OUT}CONTRACTVERIFY with improved implementation.
- The proposal includes changes in parameter order and additional flags for better script writing.

active_posts.title: Resumable channels using OP_CHECKSIGFROMSTACK
active_posts.summary:
- The proposal introduces a new way to make lightning channels resumable from a wallet seed.
- It addresses the issue of channel backups and inability to resume channel operations with static backups.
- The proposal includes a new type of channel funding transaction with additional spending path.

active_posts.title: LN Summit 2024 Organization
active_posts.summary:
- Antoine Riard is proposing to organize the LN Summit in Africa in June 2024.
- Organizing the summit in Africa will require a multi-stakeholder approach for fairness and transparency.
- Antoine invites objections or feedback and suggests surveying suitable countries for hosting the summit.

active_posts.title: Jamming Mitigation Dry Run
active_posts.summary:
- We are proceeding with the plan to conduct a "dry run" of HTLC endorsement.
- The plan includes collecting data, propagating an experimental TLV, and implementing local reputation algorithms.
- Privacy is prioritized and node operators are encouraged to participate in data collection.
